SENT.plain: Ten (2.2%) of 450 patients with BehÃ§et's disease seen over a 10 year period had arterial manifestations

This was demonstrated by occlusion of radial and superficial femoral arteries in 3, aneurysm of subclavian, innominate, common and external iliac arteries and abdominal aorta in 4, both occlusion and aneurysm of pulmonary, external iliac and renal arteries in 3
All patients were male except one
Their ages ranged from 24-36 years with a mean age of 30 +/- 5 years
